metadata.name: Tezos x Infinity Wallet #64
metadata.description:
To celebrate the launch of Tezos NFT support in the Infinity Wallet & Web3 Browser we have released a special limited edition generative Tezos NFT with over 20 billion possible variations.

https://infinitywallet.io/

objkt.name: Now There's None of You Left #226

metadata.name: Now There's None of You Left #226
metadata.description:
Strands of memory are twisted and entangled with each other, blending in and out with the surrounding fog of chaos. Each strand, like a thread of a tapestry, weaves a narrative of the self that is inseparable from the whole. Walking through a thick confusion, you see a solitary slice of the self in each iteration. 

Created in Cables.gl, "Now There’s None of You Left" is made from layers of randomly generated transparent shapes and various noise textures that are then distorted with a combination of Perlin and Simplex noise. The distortion is also built up in multiple layers, making the shapes sometimes overlay or coil over each other. All these layers of shapes, textures, noises, and distortions create a complex composition that illustrates distorted memories and eroded mind. The resulting scene can look tranquil, sometimes violent, sometimes almost empty. Strands of memory, tendrils of emotions, all brewing in the broth of forgetfulness. And in the midst of this dense confusion, you pray to find a glimpse of clarity. Are you still you, or are you me?

Controls:

[1] Set resolution to 716 x 1024 (default)

[2] Set resolution to 1433 x 2048

[3] Set resolution to 2688 x 3840

* The presets above are suitable for screen viewing up to 4k screen resolution. To set a custom resolution for printing and other purpose, add &res=[desired resolution] at the end of the URL. It will set the height of the image, and the width will be calculated automatically at 0.7 ratio. For example, to get a resolution of 4911 x 7016px (about the size of A2 paper), add &res=7016 as URL parameter.

[c] Capture a screenshot at rendered resolution in live view

Note:
There might be a very slight difference in the minor details between live view and the preview image rendered by fxhash engine. This discrepancy won't appear when you capture a screenshot using the built-in keyboard shortcut.

issuer.name: Now There's None of You Left

metadata.name: Make-believe #4
metadata.description:
#genuary32nd – Let's meet on this make-believe date, in this make-believe place.
I’m having déjà vu, or is it a memory?

This artwork is originally created for the genuary2023 prompt "Art Deco", using the same core algorithm as Memory Module. Made with fractal math and p5js.

Keyboard controls:
[s] Save the current view in live mode.
[1] to [8] Change resolution, 1.5K to 12K.
[g] Toggle texture.

URL params:
&aspect=[aspect ratio, eg 2]
&res=[resolution multiplier, 0.5-8]

Created by Elsif, 2023.02

metadata.name: Action; System #8
metadata.description:
Action; system is an experimental study inspired by the work of François Morellet. Morellet was one of the founders of the Groupe de Recherche d'Art Visuel (GRAV), founded in the 60s. His work was often informed by systems, a set of rules that determine the artwork, reducing the artist's subjectivity to a minimum.

This work explores what happens when we let go of the strict rule set. Do we ever fully let go?

-----------------
This work was released for the 2023 fundraising exhibition Cure3, and all of the proceeds and 1% of royalties will go to Parkinson's research funds. You can find more information at https://cure3.co.uk/.

-----------------
Controls
- R: new randomized output (the chances of recovering one of these outputs are very slim, that's what the next control is for)
- E: high-res output
- Double click: fullscreen

While you see the eye of Horus, your artwork is loading.

------------------
Made with p5.js & glsl
License: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

metadata.name: Glossolalia #101
metadata.description:
This series is ultimately about catharsis. The compositions can be chaotic and maybe even a little messy, but they also can be vibrant and diverse… which is really what this is trying to celebrate: diversity and expression.

Simply, it’s about the emotions associated with whatever frees you.

Please see the linked fxtext article (on the main project page) for a more in-depth dissection of the concept. It’s less of a technical discussion, and more about the experience of the artist, and how it became linked with the feelings they associate with the art.

In live mode:

For higher resolutions, you can append “&density=2” to the url to double the size, “&density=3” to triple, and so on.
(This is highly recommended.)

To adjust grain, you can append “&grain=##” to the url. 40 is the default, and 0 will remove it completely.

metadata.name: Overgrowth #95
metadata.description:
This work is an exploration of random growth focused on three interconnected elements. The first is a randomly moving brush, the second is one is an alternating overlay of white and black circles along bezier points between brush movements, and the final one being a continually decreasing brush size.

The overall result gives a complex scribble art effect. 

Created with p5.js

metadata.name: Sansuhwa #7
metadata.description: Once upon a time, in a house in an oriental village, you can see beautiful nature when you look at the window. This painting of nature is called "Sansuhwa." You can see the sun or the moon, the mountains, the sea, and the forest, but sometimes you can only see a part of them. And what you see in the bottom right is the way that Asian painting usually signs paintings. Usually, it is written in Chinese characters, but I made it specially in Korean.

metadata.name: Fragment Assembler #100
metadata.description:
Fragment Assembler is a chaos engine that creates complex abstract patterns and textures. As the artwork is drawn, it constantly recomposes itself during assembly with a series of displacement techniques, creating new forms and visual elements, while others get broken into pieces and textures. The work is orientation agnostic, and will display the output in portrait orientation on tall displays.

Intended to display on high resolution mode. The artwork renders with lower resolution by default to maintain compatibility with lower end devices. 

Press '2' to double the internal resolution (recommended).
Press 'h' to enable full internal resolution (requires a modern desktop computer).
Press space bar to reload the work.
Press 's' to save the output as PNG.
To render a 6k PNG, first press 'h', then save with 'p' (requires a modern desktop computer).


Made with p5.js & WebGL.
Best displayed with a modern desktop system & Chrome browser. 


Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: On the sea, I ... #112
metadata.description:
Generative painting based on churning waves with floating buoys. Represented in three different media.

Features:
- Three drawing styles: "watercolor" 70%, "brush" 30%, or "block" 70%
- Warm white or blue waves
- Variable border and column sizes
- Number of columns
- Calm waves at the edges or center
- Color 80% or red 20% buoys
- Buoy drawing style, "watercolor" or "brush"

Viewing in desktop Chrome is recommended for the best results.
Press ’s’ to save a screenshot. Image size is 928x1200px
Press ’p’ to pause/resume.

Add '&size=#' to the end of the live view URL to render a variation of your edition at a resolution up to 3,000 px. 

Copyright (c) 2022 Matt Perkins, hello@mattperkins.me, @nudoru on Twitter. Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, see LICENSE.txt for more information.

metadata.name: Lines & Dots [minimal] #3
metadata.description:
Minimalist artwork with lines, circles and RGB shift shader.

Previous from the minimal series: https://www.fxhash.xyz/generative/23857

metadata.name: YANF #21
metadata.description:
Yet Another Noises and Flows

After three works on landscapes I returned to an abstract work in which I used several kinds of noise fields and a different approach to flow lines.

In this work I use three intermediate images to generate the final image:
- on the first image to each pixels is assigned a color related to the value of the noise field in that point using the main color palette
- on the second image the gradient orientation (angle) of the field is used to assign colors using a secondary palette with the purpose of giving lights and shadows to the final image
- on the third image flow lines are drawn using the direction perpendicular to the gradient, in this way the flows are aligned to the contour lines

After the second and third step the new generated image is blended with the previous giving rise to the final image.

Developed with p5.js

Default resolution: 2400x1600, 1600x2400, 2000x2000 (3/2, 2/3, 1/1 aspect ratio)

[2] to redraw at double resolution (it takes four times then default)
[1] to redraw at default resolution
[s] to save a png at current resolution

Sources of variations are:
- 14 palettes
- 6 kinds of combinations of noise type and fractal type
- 8 kinds of cuts
- 3 kinds of aspect ratio
- 3 border thickness

This Generative Token uses the FastNoiseLite.js and chroma.js libraries.

Created by Andrea Belloni, fxhash: anbello, twitter: @Waterflowing0. Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, see LICENSE.txt for more information.

metadata.name: Tumble Down Light Factory #19
metadata.description:
Tumble Down Light Factory is an interpretation of light installations & murals.

It attempts to trigger the feeling of coming up on a new block in a new city to discover an unexpected piece of art that is stories tall or entering a new room, knowing there will be a projection dominating the space with its light and color.

This is an abstract distillation of those things and those feelings.

Each composition is initially drawn to a hidden “template” canvas which is sampled and then rendered on the main canvas in various ways after applying some transforms to give it some depth (and so you can actually see it.)

Viewing in full-screen is nice. You should try it.

T : Save hidden ‘template’ image
S : Save current resolution
1 -> 5 : Save low -> high resolution

metadata.name: FERAL #9
metadata.description:
FERAL tries to continue to explore further where PRIMAL left by adding more layers of noise to shape, distort and warp a grid to create topologies...

Enjoy and thanks a million times for being a part of my journey!
